src:
Na sudjenju Jeličiću saslušano troje svedoka, advokati kažnjeni, Šešelj izbačen iz sudnice

06 Nov 2019, 19:45

































Saslušavanjem troje svedoka odbrane danas je pred kruševačkim Osnovnim sudom nastavljeno sudjenje bivšem predsedniku Opštine Brus Militinu Jeličiću Jutki, optuženom za nedozvoljene polne radnje i polno uznemiravanje.Na ročištu koje je trajalo pet ipo sati, braniteljka okrivljenog, advokatica Zora Dobričanin Nikodinović i punomoćnik oštećene, advokat Borivoje Borović, nakon opomena dobili su kazne od po sto hiljada dinara, a poslanik i lider Srpske radikalne stranke Vojislav Šešelj koji je sudjenju prisustvovao kao posmatrač, posle više opomena zbog dobacivanja, pri kraju ročišta izbačen je iz sudnice.Borović je novinarima rekao da je svo troje svedoka delimično priznalo da su ih Jutka i njegovi advokati "brinovali", te da su se s njima vidjali danima pred ročište."Po meni radi se o lažnim svedocima koji su inače prijatelji okrivljenog, većinu od njih je i zaposlio. Danas su i priznali da su učestvovali u protestima 'Pravda za Jutku' odeveni u majice na kojima je to pisalo, nijedan od ovih svedoka nema kredibilitet", kazao je Borović.Ocenio je da je Šešelj želeo "da napravi gužvu, jer on nije borac za ljudska prava", ali da je to izbegnuto tako što ga je sudija izbacio iz sudnice.Advokatica optuženog Jeličića, Zora Dobričanin Nikodinović je kazala je da je iznenadjena tolikom medijskom pažnjom za ovaj slučaj, jer je oko 17 časova ispred kruševačkog suda bilo nekoliko novinarskih ekipa.Dodala je da je to ipak ne čudi jer je "ovaj predmet napravljen u medijima, svedoci oštećene daju iskaz u medijima, oštećena daje iskaz u medijima, njen punomoćnik u celovečernjem terminu daje izjave"."Nadam se da ovaj sud neće suditi na osnov dokaza koji se prikupljaju u medijima i iskaza svedoka medijima, pisanja medija, iskaza njenog punomoćnika u medijima već na osnovu činjenica i dokaza u predmetu", kazala je ona.Na novinarsko pitanje na čiji je poziv na današnje sudjenje došao Vojislav Šešelje ona je rekla da ne zna, ali da pretpostavlja da to ima veze s tim da se i Šešelj i Jeličić bave politikom, dodavši i da su na sudjenju i predstavnice nevladinih organizacija, te da su u Narodnoj stranci politički aktivni i punomoćnik oštećene Borivoje Borović, i oštećena Marija Lukić.Šešelj je novinarima rekao da mu danas sudija nije dozvolio da u svojstvu pravnog savetnik Milutina Jeličića Jutke nastupa na sudjenju, na kome je ostao kao posmatrač, te da je kasnije, isključen zbog nepoštovanja suda pošto je, kako je rekao, ukazao na neregularnosti u procesu i na "pravno neznanje" advokata Borivoja Borovića koji zastupa Mariju Lukić.Borović je, rekao je Šešelj, pripisivao Jeličiću da je kao predsednik Opštine bio nadležan za slučaj nelegalnog objekta na Pančićevom vrhu na Kopaoniku, dok je Šešelj obrazlagao da nadležnost nije na predsedniku opštine već na Ministarstvu gradjevinarstva. Ocenio je i da rekonstrukcija prepiske, koja sadrži Jeličićevo seksualno uznemiravanje Marije Lukić deluje nemoguće, da je to "podvala i hajka" na Jeličića, a Mariju Lukić je optužio da je proces pokrenula iz lične koristi.Kao prvi svedok odbrane saslušana je zamenica predsednika Opštine Brus, Jasmina Savić, koja je kazala da službeni telefoni ponekad jesu ostajali u obližnjoj kafani, ali samo "kada bi ih tamo zaboravili", potvrdila je da su gradjani mogli da koriste službene telefone, ali da službene telefone okrivljenog nisu mogli da koriste bez njegovog odobrenja.Kazala je, takodje, da je iz priče kolega čula da su neki službeni telefoni nestajali, ali nije znala da li je ta kradja prijavljena.Savić je rekla da joj se jednom desilo da se na Jeličićev broj javila Marija Lukić i da od Jeličića nikada nije dobijala neprimerene poruke, vec samo poslovne, mada je on uopšte retko slao poruke.Pomoćnik predsednika Opštine Brus, Zoran Radenković koji Jeličića poznaje trideset godina, a na mestu njegovog pomoćnika je od 2015. godine, naveo je takodje da su Jeličićeve telefone koristili mnogi od zaposlenih u njegovom kabinetu te da su im se baterije neretko punile u obližnjoj piceriji "Hani".Napomenuo je da ga je Jeličić mahom zvao telefonom, odnosno da nije imao običaj da šalje poruke, tvrdeći da je afera sa Marijom Lukić nastala zbog pokušaja Opštine da spreči izgradnju malih hidroelektrana.On, medjutim, nije znao da odgovori na pitanje advokata Borovića da li se firma Nenada Milenkovića, direktora bruskog Sportskog centra, bavila upravo pribavljanjem dozvola za male hidroelektrane.Opštinski pravobranilac Andrija Nestorović ispričao je u sudu da je na sednici Opštinskog veća u martu ili aprilu 2018. godine Jeličiću stigla poruka s Nestorovićevog broja, iako on u tom trenutku nije koristio telefon i da potom u njegovom telefonu nije bilo te poruke.U poruci je, naveo je on, pisalo "predsednične podnesite ostavku iz moralnih razloga", a Nestorović je uveren da je to učinio neko ko ima "dobro IT znanje" kako bi ga "posvadjao s Jutkom". Sudjenje će se nastaviti 20. decembra saslušavanjem ostalih svedoka.Pred Opštinskim sudom u Kruševcu danas su se okupile predstavnice Mreže Žene protiv nasilja koje su takve akcije podrške Mariji Lukić i svim ženama sa iskustvom seksualnog nasilja odražale i u Beogradu i Nišu.
text:
Three witnesses heard at Jelicic trial, lawyers fined, Seselj thrown out of court

06 Nov 2019, 18:45

































Hearing of three defense witnesses today continues the trial of former Mayor of Brus Militin Jelicic Jutka before the Krusevac Basic Court, accused of unlawful sexual acts and sexual harassment. Borivoje Borovic received fines of one hundred thousand dinars after the reprimands, and Serbian Radical Party MP and leader Vojislav Seselj, who attended the trial as an observer, was thrown out of the courtroom at the end of the hearing. Borovic told reporters that all three witnesses confessed in part that Jutka and his attorneys "cared" about them and saw them days before the hearing. "In my opinion, these are false witnesses who are friends of the defendant, most of whom he employed. and confessed to participating in 'Justice for Utah' protests by wearing t-shirts He wrote to them, none of these witnesses has credibility, "Borovic said. He estimated that Seselj wanted" to make a fuss because he is not a human rights fighter ", but that this was avoided by being thrown out of court by a judge. .Zora Dobricanin Nikodinovic's lawyer, Zora Dobricanin, said she was surprised by so much media attention for the case because there were several news crews in front of the court in Krusevac. She added that it was not surprising because "this case was made in the media , the injured party's witnesses testify in the media, the injured party gives a statement in the media, her proxy statement makes statements "." I hope that this court will not judge based on the evidence collected in the media and the testimony of the witnesses in the media, the media's writing, the testimony of her attorney. in the media already on the basis of facts and evidence in the case, "she said. Asked by a journalist on whose call for today's trial Vojislav Seselj, she did not know, and whether he assumes that it has to do with the fact that both Seselj and Jelicic are engaged in politics, adding that representatives of non-governmental organizations are also at trial, and that the proxy of the injured party Borivoje Borovic and the injured party Marija Lukic are politically active in the People's Party. Seselj is He told reporters today that the judge did not allow him to act as a legal advisor to Milutin Jelicic Jutka at the trial, where he remained as an observer, and that he was later excluded for contempt of court, as he said he had indicated irregularities in the process and "legal ignorance" of Borivoj Borovic's lawyer representing Marija Lukic.Borovic, Seselj said, attributed Jelicic as the mayor of the municipality to be in charge of the case of an illegal building at Pancevic's summit on Kopaonik, while Seselj explained that the jurisdiction was not on the mayor but on Ministry of Construction. He also said that reconstruction of the correspondence containing Jelicic's sexual harassment of Marija Lukic seemed impossible, that it was a "hoax and a chase" on Jelicic, and accused Marija Lukic of initiating the process for personal gain. As the first defense witness, the deputy mayor was heard Bruce, Jasmina Savic, who said that official phones sometimes stayed at a nearby tavern, but only "if they forgot them", confirmed that citizens could use official phones, but that the official phones of the defendant could not be used without his She also said that she heard from a colleague's story that some official phones were missing, but she did not know if the theft was reported. Savic said that it happened to her once that Jelicic's number was answered by Marija Lukic and that Jelicic never received inappropriate messages, only business ones, though he rarely sent messages at all. Assistant to the Mayor of Bruce Municipality, Zoran Radenkovic, who Jelicic he has known for thirty years, and since 2015, he has also said that Jelicic's phones have been used by many of his cabinet employees and that their batteries were often recharged at a nearby pizzeria "Hani". He said that Jelicic He mostly called on the phone, that is, he was not in the habit of sending messages, claiming that the affair with Marija Lukic was due to the municipality's attempt to prevent the construction of small hydropower plants. However, he did not know how to answer the question of Borovic's lawyer whether Nenad Milenkovic's company, director of the Sports Center in Bruno was dealing precisely with obtaining permits for small hydro power plants. Municipal Attorney Andrija Nestorovic told the court that a message from Nestorovic's number arrived at the Municipal Council session in March or April 2018, although he did not use the telephone at the time and that then there was no such message in his phone.The message, he said, was "presidential resign from mor , and Nestorovic is convinced that someone with "good IT knowledge" did it to "quarrel with Jutko". The trial will resume on December 20 with the hearing of other witnesses. Representatives of the Women Against Violence Network gathered today before the Krusevac Municipal Court, reflecting such actions in support of Marija Lukic and all women with experience of sexual violence in Belgrade and Niš.
